column1: 1 ^ Ecce quam bonum et quam jūcundum habitāre frātrēs in ūnum. ^ Behold how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity.

column4: quod dēscendit in orram vestīmentī ejus; ^ Like the precious ointment on the head
column5: that ran down upon the beard
column7: which ran down to the edge of his garment;

column2: quī dēscendit in montem Siōnis. Quoniam illīc mandāvit Dominus benedictiōnem
column3: et vītam usque in saeculum. ^ as the dew of Hermon
column4: which descendeth upon mount Sion. For there the Lord hath commanded blessing
